page.title: 07PRIMARY/SECONDARY EDUCATION
page.content: As it is a residential area, Poulton is a well established educational centre. At present, 16.2-17.7% of the population is of school age; these figures are just above the national average. The area consists of 4 primary schools, 2 secondary comprehensives, 2 special schools and also adult education facilities based at Carr Head. The primary schools have an average teacher/pupil ratio of 22:1 The two comprehensive schools are Baines School and Hodgson School. Baines was originally opened in 1717 as a boys Grammar School; girls were admitted in 1978. The school provides 160 places for sixth form students and there are 650 pupils on roll with 40 teaching staff.Hodgson High School, opened in 1933 as a Secondary Modern, has 877 pupils and 52 teaching staff.
